get.description: Returns a simple response and a timestamp showing when it was generated on our system. You can use this endpoint to test your [API credentials](ref:getting-your-api-key), [idempotency keys](ref:idempotency-keys), and make sure you're ready to explore the rest of Sendle's API endpoints. ----- While testing idempotency keys, pressing 'Try It!' every time will show you a new response for each request. If the response doesn't change, that means you were sent the same response and your idempotency key is working.

Returns how much you'll expect to pay to send a parcel, given the shipping details and your current plan. You'll receive one quote for each shipping product Sendle supports for the given route. Products are separated by details like service type (e.g. Standard vs Express) and first-mile option (whether a driver will pickup the parcel or the sender will drop it off at a valid Sendle location). When booking the delivery with a quote from this endpoint, you **need to send the selected product code** along with your order. You can get quotes for both domestic and international shipments. International parcels can be shipped from Australia and the United States to countries around the globe, or from Canada to the United States. ----- Since this is a `GET` request, the params need to be sent in the **query string**, not in the body like the [create an order](ref:createorder) endpoint requires. The `?` in the URL starts the query string. Be sure to separate terms using `=` pairs in the query string, and use [percent-encoding](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percent-encoding#Percent-encoding_reserved_characters) for all spaces or special characters like the playground on the right shows. You can type some spaces and special characters into the boxes below to see how they get encoded! If you need more information on `GET` vs `POST` requests, Mozilla's MDN [has a nice summary](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Methods). ----- Here are a few things to keep in mind while using this endpoint: - Filter the returned list according to the user‚Äôs configuration (e.g. your integration may select whether to show the pickup or drop off ‚ÄúSendle Standard‚Äù product). - Display all valid quotes with the included product names (e.g. **‚ÄúSendle Standard‚Äù**, **‚ÄúSendle Express‚Äù**). - Look at the [Parcel Weights and Dimensions](ref:parcel-weights-and-dimensions) page for advice on parcel sizes. - Look at the [First Mile](ref:first-mile) page to see how parcels enter our mail network. - We decide which currency to return based on where the parcel is being sent from, so `AUD` for Australian, `CAD` for Canadian, and `USD` for U.S. parcels. This is the currency you'll be charged in. - The ETAs returned by this endpoint are the number of **business days** until the parcel should be delivered.

parameters.name: Domestic / International
parameters.description: Orders sent domestically inside a single country or internationally.

200.description:
Successful products response.

This is an array of quotes. Create the order with the selected product's quote.

get.description: Returns how much you'll expect to pay to send a parcel, given the shipping details and your current plan. You can get quotes for both domestic and international shipments. International parcels can be shipped from Australia and the United States to countries around the globe, or from Canada to the United States. > üöß New product-aware quoting > > Your system should use the new [Get Products endpoint](ref:getproducts) instead of this endpoint. This new endpoint makes quoting easier and also lets your system see all available [shipping products](doc:products) (such as Sendle Express or Saver). > > For more information, see [the post detailing our quoting update](https://developers.sendle.com/changelog/api-products-endpoint). ----- Since this is a `GET` request, the params need to be sent in the **query string**, not in the body like the [create an order](ref:createorder) endpoint requires. The `?` in the URL starts the query string. Be sure to separate terms using `=` pairs in the query string, and use [percent-encoding](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percent-encoding#Percent-encoding_reserved_characters) for all spaces or special characters like the playground on the right shows. You can type some spaces and special characters into the boxes below to see how they get encoded! If you need more information on `GET` vs `POST` requests, Mozilla's MDN [has a nice summary](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Methods). ----- Here are a few things to keep in mind while using this endpoint: - Look at the [Parcel Weights and Dimensions](ref:parcel-weights-and-dimensions) page for advice on parcel sizes, including using our AU Domestic Unlimited Satchels. - Look at the [First Mile](ref:first-mile) page to see how parcels enter our mail network. - We decide which currency to return based on where the parcel is being sent from, so `AUD` for Australian, `CAD` for Canadian, and `USD` for U.S. parcels. This is the currency you'll be charged in. - The ETA returned by this endpoint is the number of **business days** until the parcel should be delivered.

parameters.name: Order Type
parameters.description: Select the type of order you're trying to quote, and we'll show the query params for it below.

oneOf.title: Domestic
oneOf.description: Orders sent domestically inside a single country.

pickup_country.description: [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements) country code. If not provided this will default to `AU`.

delivery_country.description: [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements) country code. If not provided this will default to `AU`.

oneOf.title: International
oneOf.description: Orders sent internationally from Australia, United States, or Canada.

pickup_country.description: [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements) country code. If not provided this will default to `AU`.

200.description:
Successful quote response.

This is an array of quotes. When calling the endpoint with your API credentials you'll receive one quote tailored for your account's current plan.

post.description: Creates an order to ship a parcel to the given delivery address. You can send parcels domestically inside Australia, Canada, and the United States. International parcels can be shipped from Australia and the United States to countries around the globe, or from Canada to the United States. With our API you can tell us the parcel size, origin, and destination, and we'll do the work to find the best route and price for your order. ----- Since this is a `POST` request, the params need to be sent in the **body** of your request as a **JSON object**. Fill out some fields below and see how the data is sent in the request example box. If you need more information on GET vs POST requests, the Mozilla MDN [has a nice summary](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Methods). ----- We decide which currency to charge based on where the parcel is being sent from, so `AUD` for Australian, `CAD` for Canadian, and `USD` for U.S. parcels. This is the currency you'll be charged in. You'll need a card for the currency you're creating orders in, so an [AUD credit card](https://app.sendle.com/dashboard/billing?currency=AUD), [CAD credit card](https://app.sendle.com/dashboard/billing?currency=CAD), or a [USD credit card](https://app.sendle.com/dashboard/billing?currency=AUD). If you don't have the correct currency enabled for your card then you'll receive an error in the response. ----- Here are a few things to keep in mind while using this endpoint: - A valid postcode **and** suburb name must be given. The suburb name is validated against the postcode, and they must match. - Make sure you send the `Content-Type: application/json` header, since you're sending the JSON body. - Look at the [Parcel Weights and Dimensions](ref:parcel-weights-and-dimensions) page for advice on parcel sizes. - Look at the [First Mile](ref:first-mile) page to see how parcels enter our mail network. - **All strings (names, addresses, ‚Ä¶) must include only [Latin characters](https://support.sendle.com/hc/en-au/articles/115002794031-International-Book-with-Latin-characters).** That's A-Z along with certain accented characters like √°, √©, √≠, √≥, and √∫. Characters may show without accents on the physical label, but this will not affect deliverability. - If the `product_code` parameter is not given, the `product` object may not be included in the response. And when sending international orders: - Canadian international orders can only be sent to the United States. - Australian and Canadian international orders can only be [picked up](ref:first-mile). - When sending from Australia, identification matching the sender name on the label must be provided for the first three pickups of international parcels. This means **the first three times international parcels get picked up,** and not the first three international parcels sent. - The sender name can't be a URL (or URL-like, e.g. `Example.com`) because of shipping restrictions. - [HS codes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harmonized_System) (in `parcel_contents`) are required when sending internationally. Senders can [lookup 6-digit codes here](https://uscensus.prod.3ceonline.com/). ----- You can prevent duplicate orders by including an [idempotency key](ref:idempotency-keys) when sending requests to this endpoint. While testing idempotency keys, pressing 'Try It!' every time will show you a new response for each request. If the response doesn't change, that means you were sent the same response and your idempotency key is working.

requestBody.description: JSON body for creating an order

oneOf.title: Domestic
oneOf.description: Orders sent domestically inside a single country.

metadata.description:
Up to 1MB of JSON key/value pairs stored with this order.

Included when viewing an order and in some bulk reports available from our system.

cover.description: Only available for Australian domestic orders.

oneOf.title: International
oneOf.description: Orders sent internationally from Australia, United States, or Canada.

pickup_date.description: If provided this must be at least one non-holiday, business day in the future ‚Äì for example, `2021-09-24` (`YYYY-MM-DD`). If this is not given it will be set to the earliest available pickup date. The pickup date is returned in the order payload on subsequent requests.

metadata.description:
Up to 1MB of JSON key/value pairs stored with this order.

Included when viewing an order and in some bulk reports available from our system.

parcel_contents.description:
International orders require a list of the parcel's contents for customs purposes. Add an entry for each item in the parcel. You can specify the quantity of each item when listing it.

The total value of an international parcel can't exceed $2000 AUD.

contents_type.description: A contents type descriptor is required to create US international orders. This field is optional for Australia and Canada.

cover.description: Only available for Australian international orders.

201.description:
Successful order response.

This response contains a full Order object. This is the same one you'll get when [viewing an order](ref:vieworder).

get.description: Returns the given order including its status, the public tracking URL, and the metadata you passed when creating it. Viewing an order should include everything that you need to know about it! Aside from the [tracking endpoint](ref:trackparcel), of course. Importantly, the `is_cancellable` key under the `scheduling` section tells you whether you can [cancel the order](ref:cancelorder).

delete.description: Cancels the given order. An order can be cancelled so long as it hasn't been collected by a driver. The way to see whether an order can still be cancelled is with the `is_cancellable` key when [viewing an order](ref:vieworder). If the order has **already been cancelled** a `200` response will be returned ‚Äì¬†this is why an [idempotency key](ref:idempotency-keys) isn't needed for this endpoint. If the order has already been **collected** a `422` failure response will be returned. Note: Cancelled orders aren't deleted from the system and should still be viewable on your dashboard in the 'cancelled' state.

200.description: Indicates that the order was successfully cancelled.

cancelled_at.description: When the order was cancelled, e.g. `2015-10-15 00:56:51 UTC`.

example.cancellation_message: Cancelled by S6LRX64PV8MABbBbzu6DoBHD during picking up

post.description: Creates a return label, letting receivers easily send orders back to the original sender. Senders can use this endpoint to prepare an order to be returned. Returns can only be placed for domestic orders. After creating the return order, you can [get a label](ref:getting-labels) using the URLs in the response. The sender can then include the return label in the parcel before it's shipped (because they aren't added to your invoice until they're used), or send the label file to the customer for them to print it out. If the receiver will be printing it, try to use A4/Letter sizes since most receivers don't have dedicated label printers. If you want a convenient page receivers can read ‚Äì which includes packaging directions ‚Äì here are our [AU Returns](https://support.sendle.com/hc/en-au/articles/4416750997389-How-to-return-a-parcel) and [US Returns](https://support.sendle.com/hc/en-us/articles/4416750997389-How-to-return-a-package) articles. After attaching the return label to the parcel, the receiver will need to leave the parcel at a [valid drop off location](https://returns.sendle.com/). ----- Since this is a `POST` request, the params need to be sent in the **body** of your request as a **JSON object**. Fill out some fields below and see how the data is sent in the request example box. If you need more information on GET vs POST requests, the Mozilla MDN [has a nice summary](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Methods). ----- Returns are [idempotent by nature](ref:idempotent-endpoints) ‚Äì sending a new return request will give you the details of the already-created return order. The customer reference and delivery instructions given on the first request will be used and can't be updated, so make sure they're right the first time.

requestBody.description: JSON body for returning an order

200.description: Successful response. This means an existing return label has been returned.

201.description: Successful response. This means a return label has been created.

get.description: Views the given return order, including the label URLs. You can [get a label](ref:getting-labels) using the URLs in this response. The sender can then include the return label in the parcel before it's shipped (because they aren't added to your invoice until they're used), or send the label file to the customer for them to print it out. If the receiver will be printing it, try to use A4/Letter sizes since most receivers don't have dedicated label printers. If you want a convenient page receivers can read ‚Äì which includes packaging directions ‚Äì here are our [AU Returns](https://support.sendle.com/hc/en-au/articles/4416750997389-How-to-return-a-parcel) and [US Returns](https://support.sendle.com/hc/en-us/articles/4416750997389-How-to-return-a-package) articles. After attaching the return label to the parcel, the receiver will need to leave the parcel at a [valid drop off location](https://returns.sendle.com/).

post.description: Creates shipping manifest(s) for the given orders. Shipping manifests let a driver collect multiple parcels while scanning one barcode on US Domestic orders. Today we have one type of shipping manifest ‚Äì [USPS SCAN Forms](https://faq.usps.com/s/article/Click-N-Ship-SCAN-Form). > üìò Info > > Since this is a `POST` request, the params need to be sent in the **body** of your request as a **JSON object.** The mdn web docs have a [summary of HTTP request methods](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Methods). ----- Keep these in mind while generating shipping manifests: - Only orders with a USPS label can currently be included on shipping manifests. - Each order can only be included on a single shipping manifest. - Shipping manifests cannot be modified after being created. - More than one shipping manifest may be returned by this endpoint. - Each order must be created **the same day as the shipping manifest.** The pickup / drop-off date can be in the future, but the order must be **created** on the same day as the shipping manifest. > üëç End-of-day manifesting > > Since shipping manifests can only be created for orders booked that day, encourage your senders to generate and print their manifests at the end of each day. > üóíÔ∏è Multi-page shipping manifests > > A single shipping manifest may include more than one SCAN form. In this case, the PDF will have multiple pages. > > Note: > > - Print and include all pages when giving a shipping manifest to the driver or when dropping the parcels off. > - Ensure the driver scans each page of the shipping manifest. > - **All orders on a single shipping manifest must be collected at the same time.** ----- If an order has **already been manifested** a `422` response will be returned ‚Äì this is why an [idempotency key](https://developers.sendle.com/reference/idempotency-keys) isn't needed for this endpoint.

requestBody.description: JSON body for creating a manifest

schema.description: Orders to include on the shipping manifest(s).

Single manifest.description: Successful manifest creation with a single response.

Multiple manifests.description: Successful manifest creation with multiple responses.

get.description: Returns all shipping manifests for your account. Shipping manifests let a driver collect multiple parcels while scanning one barcode on US Domestic orders. Today we have one type of shipping manifest ‚Äì [USPS SCAN Forms](https://faq.usps.com/s/article/Click-N-Ship-SCAN-Form). ----- This endpoint returns all shipping manifests for your account, including ones created via the API and also the Sendle dashboard.

Returns status of a shipping manifest. Shipping manifests let a driver collect multiple parcels while scanning one barcode on US Domestic orders. Today we have one type of shipping manifest ‚Äì [USPS SCAN Forms](https://faq.usps.com/s/article/Click-N-Ship-SCAN-Form). ----- This endpoint returns the status and other metadata of the given shipping manifest.

Returns all orders on a shipping manifest. Shipping manifests let a driver collect multiple parcels while scanning one barcode on US Domestic orders. Today we have one type of shipping manifest ‚Äì [USPS SCAN Forms](https://faq.usps.com/s/article/Click-N-Ship-SCAN-Form). ----- This endpoint returns all orders that are on the given shipping manifest.

Returns the printable shipping manifest. Shipping manifests let a driver collect multiple parcels while scanning one barcode on US Domestic orders. Today we have one type of shipping manifest ‚Äì [USPS SCAN Forms](https://faq.usps.com/s/article/Click-N-Ship-SCAN-Form). ----- This endpoint returns a PDF of the given shipping manifest, which can be printed.

Returns tracking details for the given parcel, including when different events happened to it. This endpoint doesn't contain precise personal location information, but can contain the city where events happen and some names (e.g. 'Parcel was signed for by JIMMY'). To get the public tracking URL that can be shared with the receiver, see the `tracking_url` key in the response from the [create](ref:createorder) or [view an order](ref:vieworder) endpoints. Note: The Sendle API does not currently expose webhooks, and this endpoint is the only way to retrieve tracking information. For updates, keep an eye on [our Changelog](https://developers.sendle.com/changelog)! ----- We recommend getting new tracking information for each parcel once per hour. You should limit your requests to this endpoint to 10 per second per unique IP. If you need a higher limit, reach out [to our team](mailto:api@sendle.com). ----- Here's most of our tracking events and what they mean: | Tracking Event | Description | | :-: | --- | | **Pickup Attempted**| Driver attempted to pickup the parcel. | | **Pickup** | Parcel successfully picked up. | | **Drop Off** | Parcel has not yet been dropped off. | | **Dropped Off** | Parcel left at a drop-off location. | | | | | **Info** | Information about the parcel. This can come from us or the delivery partner. | | **In Transit** | Parcel in transit between hub locations. | | | | | **Out for Delivery** | Driver has the parcel and is taking it to be delivered. | | **Delivery Attempted** | Parcel delivery attempted, but unsuccessful. | | **Delivered** | Parcel successfully delivered. | | **Local Delivery** | Delivery is being handled by a local partner (e.g. a local postal service or similar). | | **Card Left** | Parcel delivery attempted and a card has been left for the receiver to arrange collection or re-delivery. | | **Left with Agent** | Parcel has been left with a parcel connect location, POPStation, or similar for collection. | | | | | **Damaged** | Parcel has been marked as damaged. | | **Unable to Deliver** | Parcel could not be delivered. | | **Expired** | The label for this parcel has expired. | If you receive an event type not on this list, look at the `description` of the event for more information.

origin.description: Where the parcel's being sent from.

country.description: [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code. For example, `AU` for Australia, `CA` for Canada, and `US` for United States. This may be omitted if there is no origin/destination recorded yet.

[ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code. For example, `AU` for Australia, `CA` for Canada, and `US` for United States. This may be omitted if there is no origin/destination recorded yet.

LocalScanTime.description: Local and display time on events.

tracking_events.description: Parcel onboard courier vehicle for delivery

status.description: Your package has been delivered to your mailbox!

tracking_events.description: We attempted to pick up the parcel but were unsuccessful
Your package is in transit with the carrier.
Your package is in transit with the carrier.
tracking_events.location: JERSEY CITY NJ NETWORK DISTRIBUTION CENTER

tracking_events.description: Your package is in transit with the carrier.
Your package is in transit with the carrier.
Your package is in transit with the carrier.
Your package is on board for delivery!
Your package has been delivered to your mailbox!

Line1.description:
The street address for the location. **Do not** include the postcode, state, or suburb in this field. Best practice is to keep this under 40 chars due to label size limitations.

Addresses can be split over two lines. Only this line is mandatory, and will be shown above `address_line2` on the shipping label.

Line2.description: Second line of the street address for the location. Best practice is to keep this under 40 chars due to label size limitations.

Suburb.description:
Suburb or town of the location. This is **required** and must be given. In certain regions the name here is validated against the postcode, so must be valid and match.

If we cannot service the area, the response will be a validation error stating it's not serviceable. If you receive an unserviceable error, you may want to check whether the location is also listed under a different name.

Postcode.description:
Postcode, postal code, or ZIP code of the location. For locations in Australia and the U.S. this is a four or five digit string. In Canada it's the six character postal code.

If we cannot service the area, the response will be a validation error stating it's not serviceable.

StateName.description:
State, province, or territory of the location.

For Australia these are: ACT, NSW, NT, QLD, SA, TAS, VIC, WA, with the long-form (i.e. "Northern Territory") also accepted. For Canada these are province/territory 2 letter representations such as ON and AB. For United States these are the state's 2 letter representation such as CA and NY.

country.description:
The country this order is being sent from. If not given, Sendle assumes orders are originating from Australia.

This can be either the [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements) country code or country name. Country names can vary between different systems, so **ISO country codes should be used where possible**.

The country this order is being sent from.

This can be either the [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements) country code or country name. Country names can vary between different systems, so **ISO country codes should be used where possible**.

Country for the recipient. If not given, Sendle assumes orders are in Australia.

This can be either the [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements) country code or country name. Country names can vary between different systems, so **ISO country codes should be used where possible**.

AllowedPackaging.description: The allowed packaging for the product.

Phone.description:
A valid local phone number **including area code** or a fully qualified international number.

Examples: `(02) 1234 1234`, `+1 519 123 1234`, `+61 (0)4 1234 1234`, `(321) 555-1234`.

Company.description: Business name. This helps the driver successfully collect and deliver the parcel.

email.description: Email address for the sender. This can **only be given when sending with a supported reseller account** and is ignored otherwise.

phone.description:
A valid local phone number **including area code** or a fully qualified international number. Drivers can use this to coordinate pickup with the sender.

Examples: `(02) 1234 1234`, `+1 519 123 1234`, `+61 (0)4 1234 1234`, `(321) 555-1234`.

name.description: The sender's name. This **can't be a URL on international orders** because of shipping restrictions.

email.description: Email address for the sender. This can **only be given when sending with a supported reseller account** and is ignored otherwise.

phone.description:
A valid local phone number **including area code** or a fully qualified international number. Drivers can use this to coordinate pickup with the sender.

Examples: `(02) 1234 1234`, `+1 519 123 1234`, `+61 (0)4 1234 1234`, `(321) 555-1234`.

email.description: The receiver's email address. Sendle uses this to give the receipient parcel updates.

phone.description:
A valid local phone number **including area code** or a fully qualified international number. Drivers can use this to coordinate delivery with the receiver.

Examples: `(02) 1234 1234`, `+1 519 123 1234`, `+61 (0)4 1234 1234`, `(321) 555-1234`.

currency.description: Currency of the above amount. For example, `AUD` for Australian Dollars, `CAD` for Canadian Dollars, and `USD` for United States Dollars.

CoverResponse.description: Explains the cover and associated costs applicable to the order

price.description: Explain the cover costs applicable to the order.

gross.description: Total price of any cover including taxes.

tax.description: Tax that applies to any cover net price.

CourierInstructionsSender.description: Short message with pickup instructions for the driver. Should be under 40 chars due to label size limitations.

CourierInstructionsSenderNullable.description: Short message with pickup instructions for the driver. Should be under 40 chars due to label size limitations.

CourierInstructionsReceiver.description:
Short message with delivery instructions for the driver. Should be under 40 chars due to label size limitations.

Note: Satchels are ATL only, but can include delivery instructions.

Cover.description: Only available for Australian domestic and international orders.

TotalCoverAmount.description: The decimal string value detailing the amount of cover for the parcel.

FirstMileOption.description:
Whether the parcel will be picked up or dropped off. This parameter is **deprecated** in favour of using the [Get Products endpoint](ref:getproducts) and selecting a matching [Product Code](https://developers.sendle.com/v99.94/changelog/api-products-endpoint).

You **should give this** if the product code isn't provided. If not specified this will default to `pickup`.

HidePickupAddress.description: Only used on orders sent within or from Australia. Tells us whether to leave the street address of the sender off the label. If not given, the account preferences are respected.

manifest_ref.description: String reference identifying manifest, prefixed with M

status.description: Current status of manifest. Once completed it will be available to download

tracking_url.description: The order's **public** tracking page. Tracking page updates as the parcel progresses from sender to receiver. This **can be shared and viewed without a Sendle Account** and **contains no personal information** about either party.

order_url.description: Specific API url for this order. After booking, this url becomes the point to check for updated information (state changes), labels and any other information related to the order.

status.description: This contains extra information about the order state. Only included when an order is viewed, not in the order creation response.

description.description: User-readable description of the order's current state.

last_changed_at.description: Date the order changed to the current state, e.g. `2021-09-24`.

labels.description: Shipping labels for the order. QR code labels will only be returned for eligible Australian drop off orders. See the [getting labels](ref:getting-labels) page for information on how to use these URLs.

format.description: Format of the label. We currently provide QR code labels in `png` format and other labels as `pdf`.

size.description: Size of the label. Label size will either be `cropped` or `a4`/`letter` depending on the country the parcel's being sent from. QR codes are only available in the `cropped' size.

url.description: URL to receive the label with. This will redirect you to a file in the specified format that can be freely accessed for one minute.

address_line1.description: The street address for the location. This line will be shown above `address_line2` on the shipping label.

address_line2.description: Second line of the street address for the location.

suburb.description: Suburb or town of the location.

postcode.description: Postcode, postal code, or ZIP code of the location.

state_name.description: State, province, or territory this order is sent from.

country.description: Country that this order is sent from.

email.description: The receiver's email address. Sendle uses this to give the receipient parcel updates.

address_line1.description: The street address for the location. This line will be shown above `address_line2` on the shipping label.

address_line2.description: Second line of the street address for the location.

suburb.description: Suburb or town of the location.

postcode.description: Postcode, postal code, or ZIP code of the location.

state_name.description: State, province or territory this order is sent to.

country.description: Country that this order is being sent to.

description.description:
Gives the receiver information about the parcel in tracking emails and on their Sendle dashboard. This should be human readable and meaningful (e.g. "Cat Socks Order #143", not just "#143").

**This does not show up on the label.**

customer_reference.description: Extra information that **will appear on the label**. This can be used for pick and pack purposes, to help with parcel identification, or anything else the sender needs.

dimensions.description: The order's dimensions. Only returned if dimensions are provided during [order creation](ref:createorder).

metadata.description: Up to 1MB of JSON key/value pairs stored with this order.

hide_pickup_address.description: Whether the sender's address is hidden on the label. **Only available for AU senders**

scheduling.description: Information regarding the order's pickup date and shipping.

pickup_date.description: This is the date the driver should pick up the order. May be `null` depending on the order status or for drop off orders.

picked_up_on.description: This is the date the order was collected. May be `null` depending on the order status.

delivered_on.description: This is the date the order was delivered. May be `null` depending on the order status.

estimated_delivery_date_minimum.description: The earliest parcel delivery date we estimate. May be `null` depending on the order status. **domestic only**

estimated_delivery_date_maximum.description: The latest date parcel delivery date we estimate. May be `null` depending on the order status. **domestic only**

description.description: A human readable description of the route.

type.description: A machine readable version of the route type. Can be one of: `same-city`, `national`, `remote`, or `export`.

delivery_guarantee_status.description:
Whether this parcel is covered by our [2-Day Delivery Guarantee](https://support.sendle.com/hc/en-au/articles/360002361031-Sendle-s-2-Day-Delivery-Guarantee). Only present if the account has been enrolled in this programme.

This is either `eligible` or `ineligible`.

price_breakdown.description: Explains the components of the price. Elements underneath refer to different line items. These items summed equal the gross price.

base.description: The base price for this route.

fuel_surcharge.description: Any fuel surcharge that is applied.

base_tax.description: Tax that applies to the base price.

discount_tax.description: Tax that applies to any discounts.

cover_tax.description: Tax that applies to any cover price.

fuel_surcharge_tax.description: Tax that applies to the fuel surcharge.

service.description: Any service cost that is applied.

tax_breakdown.description: Explains the taxes applicable to the price.

gst.description: [Australian Goods and Services Tax](https://www.ato.gov.au/business/gst/) or [Canadian Goods and Services Tax](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/forms-publications/publications/rc4027/doing-business-canada-gst-hst-information-non-residents.html#what_is) (depending on the order's origin).

parcel_contents.description:
List of the parcel's contents for customs purposes. One entry for each item in the parcel.

This is only returned for international orders.

description.description: Detailed description of the contents **for customs purposes.** For example, "Womens Shirt 100% Cotton" or "Tin Scale Model". Be descriptive about **what the item is,** but **try not to describe designs on the item.** For example, descriptions like "butterfly t-shirt" or "butterfly figurine" can delay customs processing because 'butterfly' is an animal.

value.description: The value of one of these items. For example, if shipping twenty $1 items, the value would be `1` and the quantity would be `20`. Must be a decimal value greater than or equal to 0.01

quantity.description: How many of this item are in the parcel?

country_of_origin.description:
The country where the goods were manufactured.

This can be either the [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements) country code or country name. Country names can vary between different systems, so **ISO country codes should be used where possible**.

hs_code.description: A [Harmonized System](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harmonized_System) code for this item, appropriate for the destination country. Single HS tarrif code only. Must contain 6‚Äì10 digits with separating dots.

expires_at.description: Date and time of when the label will expire **in UTC**. Timestamp format is [described in RFC 3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8).

OrderID.description: The order's unique identifier (UUID) in Sendle's system. This value is used by the API.

DimensionUnit.description:
The unit of measurement for the dimensions.

Must be one of `cm` (centimetres) or `in` (inches).

HeightValue.description: A decimal string value detailing the height of the parcel.

LengthValue.description: A decimal string value detailing the length of the parcel.

PackagingType.description: The type of packaging used to send the parcel.

VolumeValue.description: A decimal string value detailing the volume of the parcel.

VolumeUnit.description:
The unit of measurement for the volume.

Must be one of `l` (litres), `m3` (cubic metres), `in3` (cubic inches) or `ft3` (cubic feet).

WeightValue.description: A decimal string value detailing how heavy the parcel is.

WeightUnit.description:
The unit of measurement for the weight.

Must be one of `kg` (kilograms), `lb` (pounds), `g` (grams) or `oz` (ounces).

WidthValue.description: A decimal string value detailing the width of the parcel.

PickupDate.description:
This param is used when your order is being picked up by a driver for the [first mile](ref:first-mile).

If provided this must be at least one non-holiday, business day in the future ‚Äì for example, `2021-09-24` (`YYYY-MM-DD`). If this is not given it will be set to the earliest available pickup date. The pickup date is returned in the order payload on subsequent requests.

atl_only.description: Whether this product only supports <<glossary:ATL>> (Authority To Leave delivery instructions).

code.description: The identifier for this product. To select this product for a request, send this product code.

name.description: A human readable name for this shipping product, which should be displayed to the user.

first_mile_option.description: Whether the parcel will be picked up by a driver or dropped off by the shipper.

service.description: The type of service for this product, for example `standard`, `express`.

ProductCode.description: Which shipping product to use ‚Äì for example `STANDARD-PICKUP`, `STANDARD-DROPOFF`, `EXPRESS-PICKUP`. When not given, this is set to the default product for your plan and the selected first mile option.

ProductQuote.description: This contains the price you'll expect to pay for this delivery when using this shipping product, and when it should be delivered.

plan.description: Name of the plan this quote is for.

days_range.description: How many **business days** it should take for your parcel to be delivered.

date_range.description: The approximate delivery date of this parcel.

for_send_date.description: The above ETA assumes the parcel is picked up on this date.

Quote.description: This contains the price you'll expect to pay for this delivery, and when it should be delivered.

plan_name.description: Name of the plan this quote is for.

days_range.description: How many **business days** it should take for your parcel to be delivered.

date_range.description: The approximate delivery date of this parcel.

for_pickup_date.description: The above ETA assumes the parcel is picked up on this date.

instructions.description:
Short message with delivery instructions for the driver. Should be under 40 characters due to label size limitations.

Letting receivers specify delivery instructions improves the likelihood the parcel will be delivered.

Note: Satchels are ATL only, but can include delivery instructions.

description.description: A human readable description of the route.

type.description: A machine readable version of the route type. Can be one of: `same-city`, `national`, `remote`, or `export`.

instructions.description:
Short message with pickup instructions for the driver. Should be under 40 characters due to label size limitations.

Including pickup instructions increases the chance of a successful pickup.

Short message with pickup instructions for the driver. Should be under 40 characters due to label size limitations.

Including pickup instructions increases the chance of a successful pickup.

SendleReference.description: Unique reference for this order, used to access the public tracking page. Sendle references begin with an "S" and are an alphanumeric string six or more characters in length.

currency.description: Currency of the above amount. For example, `AUD` for Australian Dollars, `CAD` for Canadian Dollars, and `USD` for United States Dollars.

rate.description: The rate of this tax. For example, a **10%** tax returns `0.1` here.

TaxIDs.description: Collection of tax information for customs purposes.

ioss.description:
The [IOSS tax ID](https://ec.europa.eu/taxation_customs/business/vat/ioss_en) of the sender, for VAT collection purposes. This starts with `IM` and is followed by 10 digits.

**This field speeds up customs processing for orders sent to the EU.** It's optional for personal items, but should be provided by commercial senders. Failure to do so may result in transit delays or the receiver needing to pay unpaid VAT and administration fees.

TrackingEvents.description: A set of tracking scans from pickup to delivery.

event_type.description: Type of scan event. The standard types are `Pickup`, `Info`, and `Delivered`, but the table above explains more.

scan_time.description: Date and time of the scan event **in UTC.** Timestamp format is [described in RFC 3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8).

local_scan_time.description: Date and time of the scan event, in the location the event happened. This value does not contain a timezone.

display_time.description: The timestamp that should be shown to users for this event. It contains the local scan time with a timezone if available, and otherwise the scan time in UTC. Timestamp format is [described in RFC 3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8).

description.description: Short description of the scan event.

origin_location.description: While transiting, shows the location of the physical hub the parcel's departing from.

destination_location.description: While transiting, shows the location of the physical hub the parcel's arriving to.

location.description: City, state, and country where the scan event happened (e.g. "SYDNEY, NSW, Australia").

location_data.description: Programmatically accessible representation of the location where the scan event happened

suburb.description: The suburb or city of the scan

state.description: The state of the scan, where possible this will be the state code

postcode.description: The postcode, postal code, or zip code of the scan, when available

country.description:
The country the scan occured in.

This can be either the [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements) country code or country name. Country names can vary between different systems, so **ISO country codes should be used where possible**.

reason.description: Extra information about why the scan event happened, e.g. an attempted delivery usually records why the parcel couldn't be delivered.

requester.description: Extra information about who requested the event, e.g. if an event happened because the sender asked us to do so, this should say 'Sender'.

messages.description: Contains messages describing how each field was invalid.

ErrorBadRequestManifests.description: Indicates that shipping manifests cannot be used by the given account. Please create a US-based account to access shipping manifests.

ErrorInternal.description: Indicates that an unhandled error has occured with the Sendle API. We may have more information on the [Sendle Status page](https://status.sendle.com/). Contact [support@sendle.com](mailto:support@sendle.com) if the problem persists.

ErrorNotAvailable.description: Indicates that Sendle is temporarily offline for maintenance or upgrades. We may have more information on the [Sendle Status page](https://status.sendle.com/).

example.error_description: Service is temporarily unavailable. Please check back soon.

ErrorNotFound.description: Indicates that the given order ID, label URL, parcel reference, or other URI couldn't be found. Double-check the ID or URL before retrying. This can also mean you're trying to return an order you're not the sender/creator of.

example.error_description: The resource you requested was not found. Please check the URI and try again.

ErrorPaymentRequired.description:
Indicates that your Sendle account does not have a credit card on file or that there is another payment-related issue. The error description will have more details and tell you how to resolve this.

**Non-booking endpoints will continue to work and will not receive an error.**

example.error_description: The account associated with this API key has no method of payment. Please go to your Account Settings in your Sendle Dashboard and add a payment method.

ErrorPreconditionFailed.description:
Indicates that the [dangerous goods terms](ref:getting-your-api-key) have not been accepted on Sendle account.

**Non-booking endpoints will continue to work and will not receive an error.**

example.error_description: The account associated with this API key has not accepted the dangerous goods terms. Please visit your Account Settings in your Sendle Dashboard to view and accept these terms.

ErrorTooEarly.description:
Indicates that you need to retry the request at a later time.

This is returned when a call is made with the same idempotency key, but the initial call has not returned a response yet. Once the initial call returns a response, this status code will no longer be sent.

example.error_description: The idempotency key you have provided has not completed its initial request.

ErrorTooManyRequests.description: Indicates that you've sent too many requests and have been throttled. The `X-RateLimit-Reset` header gives the date/time when the current rate limit window resets (e.g. `2037-03-27 05:13:30 +0000`).

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The date/time when the current rate limit window resets.

ErrorUnauthorised.description: Indicates that your Sendle ID or API key was incorrect or not provided. You should double-check your [API credentials](ref:getting-your-api-key) and confirm whether you're using sandbox or production details.

enum: The authorisation details are not valid. Either the Sendle ID or API key are incorrect.

example.error_description: The authorisation details are not valid. Either the Sendle ID or API key are incorrect.

ErrorUnprocessableEntityManifestDownload.description: Indicates that the given manifest cannot be downloaded.

Manifest download error.description: Returned when the manifest could not be downloaded.

value.error_description: Manifest is still processing, please try again when completed.

ErrorUnprocessableEntityProducts.description: Indicates that the given input could not be processed or was invalid. This is also returned when we can't service the given route yet.

No values given.description: Returned when proper values aren't given on a quote.

sender_country: products are not currently available from the specified country of origin
weight_units: is not included in the list

value.error_description: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

Can't pickup international order.description: Returned when we can't pickup from the origin address.

base: is not yet serviced by Sendle

value.error_description: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

PO box pickup.description: Returned when you can't pickup from a PO box.

receiver_address_line1: Sorry, we can't pick up from or deliver to PO boxes, locked bags, or parcel lockers.

value.error_description: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

Invalid Cover Amount.description: Returned when an invalid cover amount is provided on a quote.

total_cover_amount: must be less than or equal to 1500
cover is not currently available from the specified country of origin

value.error_description: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

ErrorUnprocessableEntityQuote.description: Indicates that the given input could not be processed or was invalid. This is also returned when we can't service the given route yet.

No values given.description: Returned when proper values aren't given on a quote.

value.error_description: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

Can't pickup international order.description: Returned when we can't pickup from the origin address.

base: is not yet serviced by Sendle

value.error_description: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

PO box pickup.description: Returned when you can't pickup from a PO box.

pickup_address_line1: Sorry, we can't pick up from or deliver to PO boxes, locked bags, or parcel lockers.

value.error_description: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

Invalid Cover Amount.description: Returned when an invalid cover amount is provided on a quote.

total_cover_amount: must be less than or equal to 1500
cover is not currently available from the specified country of origin

value.error_description: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

ErrorUnprocessableEntityOrder.description: Indicates that the given input could not be processed or was invalid. This is also returned when we can't service the given route yet.

Can't pickup international order.description: Returned when we can't pickup from the given address.

base: is not yet serviced by Sendle

value.error_description: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

Invalid pickup date.description: Returned when an invalid pickup date is provided.

pickup_date: must be a business day and at least one business day in the future.

value.error_description: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

Invalid data.description: Returned when multiple invalid values are given on an order booking request.

pickup_date: must be a business day and at least one business day in the future.

phone: must be a valid phone number. 13, 1300, and 1800 numbers are not allowed.

email: must be a valid email address
name: is too long (maximum is 200 characters)

value.error_description: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

Invalid product.description: Returned when we can't use the given product for the route (always use the [Get Products endpoint](ref:getproducts) to see the valid products for an order).

base: is not yet serviced by Sendle

value.error_description: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

PO box delivery.description: Returned when we can't deliver to the given address.

address_line1: Sorry, we can't pick up from or deliver to PO boxes, locked bags, or parcel lockers.

value.error_description: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

Invalid cover amount.description: Returned when the cover amount requested for a parcel is invalid.

cover: must be less than or equal to 1500
cover is not currently available from the specified country of origin

value.error_description: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

ErrorUnprocessableEntityReturn.description: Indicates that the given input could not be processed or was invalid.

Can't return international order.description: Returned when we can't return an international order.

value.error_description: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

ErrorUnprocessableEntityShippingManifest.description: Indicates that the given input could not be processed or was invalid.

Including un-manifestible orders.description: Returned when we can't include orders on a shipping manifest.

value.error_description: One or more of the provided orders cannot be included in this manifest

ErrorUnprocessableEntityManifestNotFound.description: Indicates that the given shipping manifest could not be found.

Including un-manifestible orders.description: Returned when we can't find the given shipping manifest.

value.error_description: The manifest id provided is invalid

ErrorUnprocessableEntityCancelOrder.description: Indicates that the given order couldn't be cancelled. This schema **differs from our regular `422` responses**, so keep that in mind if you want to process this error.

messages.description: Contains a message describing that the order couldn't be cancelled.

enum: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

Order can't be cancelled.description: Returned when an order can't be cancelled.

value.messages: Order can not be cancelled. Get in touch with Sendle support if you need more help with this.
value.error_description: The data you supplied is invalid. Error messages are in the messages section. Please fix those fields and try again.

IdempotencyKey.name: Idempotency-Key
IdempotencyKey.description: Key to ensure this API request is unique. For examples, see the [Idempotency Keys section](ref:idempotency-keys).

OrderID.name: id
OrderID.description:
The Sendle Order ID. The order's individual identification in our system.
For example, `f5233746-71d4-4b05-bf63-56f4abaed5f6`.

This **isn't** the reference that's used for the public tracking page.

SendleReference.name: ref
SendleReference.description:
The order's unique reference. This is the short ID that can be shared, for example `SNFJJ3` or `S34WER4S`.

This **isn't** the internal order ID that's used for other API calls.

ShippingManifestID.name: id
ShippingManifestID.description:
The shipping manifest ID. This is the manifest's individual identification in our system.
For example, `f5233746-71d4-4b05-bf63-56f4abaed5f6`.

UserAgent.name: User-Agent
UserAgent.description:
Name of your service, site, or some other informative value.

Including this lets our team identify your requests and ensures that they aren't blocked by our security tools.

basicAuth.description:
These are your Sendle API credentials.

The Username and Password are your Sendle ID and API Key, found [here on the _LIVE_ Dashboard](https://www.sendle.com/dashboard/api_settings) or [here on the _TESTING_ Sandbox Dashboard](https://sandbox.sendle.com/dashboard/api_settings).
